data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Blinding Scythe attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Shuckle
data.flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

attacks.name: Berry Picking
attacks.text: Shuffle up to 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: It roams through forests searching for sweet nectar. Although it boasts fantastic physical strength, it's not that good at flying.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Lotad
data.flavorText: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

attacks.name: Mini Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ludicolo
data.flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.

attacks.name: Spirited Rushdown
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Prize card you have taken.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lombre
data.flavorText: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.

abilities.name: Top Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

attacks.name: Threatening Pattern
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Energy can't be attached from your opponent's hand to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.

data.name: Abomasnow
data.flavorText: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Phantump
data.flavorText: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit's rebirth as this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Guidance
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

data.name: Rillaboom VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Beating
attacks.text: You may discard up to 3 Grass Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Rillaboom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Forest Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Trevenant
data.flavorText: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it's kind.

attacks.name: Shadow Cage
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

data.name: Applin
data.flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Eldegoss V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Happy Match
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Float Up
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Applin
data.flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.name: Flapple
data.flavorText: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

abilities.name: Apple Drop
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Appletun
data.flavorText: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.

abilities.name: Delicious Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

attacks.name: Hex
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Ninetales V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Nine-Tailed Shapeshifter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

abilities.name: Warming Up
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Burning Scarf attached, it gets +100 HP.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.

attacks.name: Scorch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

attacks.name: Heat Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Magmortar
data.flavorText: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Ground Burn
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of their deck. This attack does 100 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it's feared as an emissary of death.

abilities.name: Top Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Reignite
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Chandelure
data.flavorText: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

abilities.name: Protective Glow
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have Energy attached have no Weakness.

attacks.name: Mirage Flare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cinderace VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Max Pyro Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Cinderace V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Field Runner
abilities.text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Rime
data.flavorText: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

abilities.name: Screen Cleaner
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed.)

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

attacks.name: Leap Out
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Pelipper
data.flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Wingull
data.flavorText: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.

attacks.name: Big Storm
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium in play.

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: Graceful ripples running across the water's surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.

attacks.name: Spiral Attack
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Milotic V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

attacks.name: Twirling Sign
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan
data.flavorText: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crushing Headbutt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Crushing Headbutt.

data.name: Inteleon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snipe Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Inteleon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Snipe
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

attacks.name: Max Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cramorant
data.flavorText: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Darumaka
data.flavorText: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.

attacks.name: Ice Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Seismitoad
data.flavorText: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Resonance
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Eiscue
data.flavorText: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

abilities.name: Ice Face
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, it takes 60 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Barraskewda
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

attacks.name: Spiral Jet
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you don't, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Eiscue V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cold Absorption
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, heal 30 damage from it.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Arrokuda
data.flavorText: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

attacks.name: Orb Collector
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: While it's often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Under Pressure
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Luxio during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

abilities.name: Top Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

data.name: Electivire
data.flavorText: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electrified Bolt
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Charjabug
data.flavorText: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Vikavolt
data.flavorText: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt Beam
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Helioptile
data.flavorText: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Heliolisk
data.flavorText: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

attacks.name: Eerie Impulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Boltund V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Electrify
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bolt Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Toxtricity
data.flavorText: When this Pokémon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.

attacks.name: Poison Shout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Toxtricity V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Electric Riot
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Toxtricity VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Riot
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pincurchin V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Counterattack Kerzap
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

attacks.name: Shining Fingers
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

abilities.name: Prankish
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon on top of their deck.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

attacks.name: Energy Warp
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Corsola
data.flavorText: Watch your step when wandering areas oceans once covered. What looks like a stone could be this Pokémon, and it will curse you if you kick it.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Galarian Cursola
data.flavorText: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon's core spirit.

abilities.name: Perish Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.flavorText: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians' emissaries.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Sandygast
data.flavorText: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Palossand
data.flavorText: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.

attacks.name: Sand Sink
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If this Pokémon has a Cursed Shovel attached, discard 2 more cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Super Absorption
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Hattrem
data.flavorText: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brutal Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Milcery
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Hatenna
data.flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Hatterene
data.flavorText: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

abilities.name: Mind Hat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Each player discards a card from their hand. (Your opponent discards first.)

attacks.name: Dripping Grudge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Alcremie
data.flavorText: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

attacks.name: Decorate
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Indeedee
data.flavorText: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.

attacks.name: Replenish Time
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Dragapult
data.flavorText: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Phantom Force
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Dragapult V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Assault
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Dragapult VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Phantom
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Meditite
data.flavorText: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.

attacks.name: Yoga Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Nosepass
data.flavorText: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

data.name: Drakloak
data.flavorText: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

attacks.name: Summon
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Dreepy and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dreepy
data.flavorText: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Galarian Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: The Farfetch'd of the Galar region are brave warriors, and they wield thick, tough leeks in battle.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Galarian Sirfetch'd
data.flavorText: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.

attacks.name: Meteor Assault
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Meteor Assault again until it leaves the Active Spot.

data.name: Whiscash
data.flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Medicham
data.flavorText: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Yoga Kick
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Barboach
data.flavorText: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.

data.name: Galarian Yamask
data.flavorText: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask's dark power.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Galarian Runerigus
data.flavorText: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

attacks.name: Spreading Spite
attacks.text: For each damage counter on this Galarian Runerigus, put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mad Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Binacle
data.flavorText: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Barbaracle
data.flavorText: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Hand Press
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Rolycoly
data.flavorText: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

data.name: Carkol
data.flavorText: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

data.name: Sandaconda V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sand Eater
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Breath
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Falinks
data.flavorText: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Team Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has "Falinks" in its name.

data.name: Coalossal
data.flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Tar Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Falinks V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Iron Defense Formation
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have "Falinks" in their name take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Stonjourner
data.flavorText: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

attacks.name: Splitting Spite
attacks.text: Discard the top card of each player's deck.

attacks.name: Dripping Grudge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Galarian Weezing
data.flavorText: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.

abilities.name: Neutralizing Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Neutralizing Gas.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup.

data.name: Stunky
data.flavorText: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Skuntank
data.flavorText: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon's diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Malamar V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brain Shake
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Mandibuzz
data.flavorText: Although it's a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they're ready to leave the nest.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Malamar VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Jammer
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

abilities.name: Poisonous Puddle
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

data.name: Grimmsnarl
data.flavorText: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.

abilities.name: Dark Oath
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Impidimp
data.flavorText: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

data.name: Morgrem
data.flavorText: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it's trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

attacks.name: False Surrender
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Meowth
data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

abilities.name: Evolution Roar
abilities.text: You must discard 2 cards from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Galarian Perrserker, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Bronzong
data.flavorText: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

attacks.name: Gathering Food
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to this Pokémon, search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Probopass
data.flavorText: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

attacks.name: Gravitational Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker
data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

attacks.name: Claw Dagger
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Scizor
data.flavorText: Once it has identified something as an enemy, it will continue beating them with its steel-hard pincers until there's nothing left but scraps.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Scyther during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Bronzor
data.flavorText: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn't come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.

data.name: Zacian
data.flavorText: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smashing Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.

attacks.name: Double Slash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Copperajah V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Diggersby
data.flavorText: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It's a huge help during tunnel construction.

attacks.name: Mining Rush
attacks.text: Discard up to 6 cards from the top of your deck. If you do, this attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.

abilities.name: Big Shield
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Big Shield Ability at a time.

data.name: Copperajah VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Nose
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Tranquill
data.flavorText: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Chatot
data.flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

abilities.name: Lucky Match
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you're scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.

attacks.name: Chirp
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon with Fighting Resistance, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Unfezant
data.flavorText: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Greedent
data.flavorText: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn't notice the loss.

abilities.name: Greedy Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Burning Scarf
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
If the Fire Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Capacious Bucket
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Skwovet
data.flavorText: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: Honedge's soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge's body.

data.name: Duraludon
data.flavorText: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

attacks.name: Metal Sharpener
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Zamazenta
data.flavorText: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Hawlucha
data.flavorText: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.

attacks.name: Windfall
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.

data.name: Bewear
data.flavorText: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Big Throw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard your opponent's Active Pokémon and all attached cards.

data.name: Dubwool V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Soft Wool
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Cursed Shovel
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Full Heal
rules: Your Active Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Nugget
rules: You can play this card only if you drew it from your deck at the beginning of your turn, before you put it into your hand.
Draw 3 cards.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Dan
rules: Draw 2 cards. You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors until someone wins. If you win, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Galar Mine
rules: The Retreat Cost of both Active Pokémon is ColorlessColorless more.
This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Milo
rules: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand, and draw 2 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Oleana
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Trainer card you find there on the bottom of their deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Scoop Up Net
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX into your hand. (Discard all attached cards.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Eldegoss V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Happy Match
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Float Up
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Rillaboom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Forest Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Dragapult V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jet Assault
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Rillaboom VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Beating
attacks.text: You may discard up to 3 Grass Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Cinderace VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

attacks.name: Max Pyro Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Training Court
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put a basic Energy card from their discard pile into their hand.
This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Turffield Stadium
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for an Evolution Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Horror Psychic Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Psychic Energy.
If the Psychic Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Speed Lightning Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Lightning Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to a Lightning Pokémon, draw 2 cards.

data.name: Skyla
rules: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Sonia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon or up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Tool Scrapper
rules: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tools attached to Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Capture Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to a Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Twin Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it provides ColorlessColorless Energy.
If this card is attached to a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it provides Colorless Energy instead.

data.name: Ninetales V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Nine-Tailed Shapeshifter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Boltund V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Electrify
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bolt Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Toxtricity V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Electric Riot
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Sandaconda V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sand Eater
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Breath
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dubwool V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Soft Wool
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Inteleon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Snipe
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

attacks.name: Max Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cinderace V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Field Runner
abilities.text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Milotic V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Inteleon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snipe Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Falinks V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Iron Defense Formation
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have "Falinks" in their name take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Malamar V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brain Shake
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Copperajah V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Milo
rules: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand, and draw 2 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Oleana
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Trainer card you find there on the bottom of their deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Sonia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon or up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Milo
rules: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand, and draw 2 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker
data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

abilities.name: Steely Spirit
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Tool Scrapper
rules: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tools attached to Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Malamar VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Jammer
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

data.name: Frosmoth
data.flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

abilities.name: Ice Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.

data.name: Toxtricity VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Riot
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Copperajah VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Nose
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Oleana
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Trainer card you find there on the bottom of their deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Sonia
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon or up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Scoop Up Net
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX into your hand. (Discard all attached cards.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Twin Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it provides ColorlessColorless Energy.
If this card is attached to a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it provides Colorless Energy instead.

data.name: Dragapult VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Phantom
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Big Charm
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +30 HP.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
